newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Nikkei futures break 18,000 resistance.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Nikkei futures break 18,000 resistance.

text.p: SIMEX Nikkei 225 June futures got a boost from Wall Street and broke key resistance of 18,000 in the first-half trading session on Wednesday, dealers said.
They said the market attempted to break 18,000 several times on Tuesday but failed.
"Dow's 135 points rise overnight gave the initial boost to break 18,000," a dealer with a European institution said.
"After that was breached, several buy-stop orders were triggered and pushed the Nikkei up to 18,140," he said.
At 0250 GMT, June was at 18,035 against its previous close of 17,945. Turnover was light at 4,265 lots.
Dealers said the Niikei remained underpinned by the Bank of Japan (BOJ) governor's assurance that he has no intention of changing its accommodative money policy in the near future.
The comments were reinforced by the BOJ's money operations on Tuesday when it drained 400 billion yen from the market against an estimated 510 billion yen surplus, dealers said.
The April MSCI Taiwan index contract was trading around 360.1 against its previous close at 359.2. Turnover was at 489 lots.
